name: 'The Two Bartlets' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many nights did Josh say he and Amy spent together?
questions.explanation:
Six.

	Amy said they spent four nights together, but Josh listed four of them over the phone before he realized it was Leo on the phone and not Amy. Leo stopped him before he could get too intimate. Another unfortunate fact was that Margaret was also in the room with Leo when Josh was on the phone.

Iowa.

	The President was going to Cedar Rapids, Iowa to officially start the Presidential primary season.

questions.text: CJ wanted Toby to attend the 4-H Convention to see the butter exhibit.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Butter exhibit at the 4-H Convention had a butter cow, butter Elvis, and a butter Last Supper with real butter on the table. To annoy Toby, CJ kept repeating "Butter, butter, butter, butter, butter, butter, butter."

questions.text: Who did Donna ask to get her out of jury duty?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	Donna's reason for not wanting to go to jury duty was because she hates criminals. Josh told her if she got out of jury duty she couldn't complain about the OJ Simpson verdict.

questions.text: What was the name of Josh's protester friend?
questions.explanation:
Billy.

	Leo wanted Josh to convince Billy to stop protesting so they could get a carrier group combat certified. Josh thought it was a crappy thing to do to a friendship.

questions.text: What did Toby say to President Bartlet that upset him?
questions.correct: Toby said the President's father didn't like him.
options: Toby didn't like what he said in Iowa.
They were going to the 4-H Convention.
Josh and Amy weren't going on vacation.
questions.explanation:
Toby said the President's father didn't like him.

	Toby and the President had it out in the Oval Office about the President's father not liking him because he was smarter than his dad.

questions.text: Where were Josh and Amy going on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Tahiti.

	Josh had Amy find someone to stay with her dog so he could take her to Tahiti.

questions.text: Toby referred to President Bartlet as _____ Fluffy and Dr. Jekyll.
questions.explanation:
Uncle.

	President Bartlet has been referred by these names several times throughout the series, hence, the title of the episode 'Two Bartlets'.

questions.text: Toby said, "When the gods wish to punish us they answer our prayers."
questions.explanation:
True.

	Toby made this statement first in Italian and then he translated it. He was talking about President Bartlet.

questions.text: Did Josh and Amy go on vacation?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Because they couldn't go to Tahiti, Josh decorated his apartment to look like they were in Tahiti. The song "Red, Red Wine" by UB40 played in the background when Josh turned on the lights.
